description.narrative: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market-level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

The project comprises the development, construction, and operation and maintenance of a 50 MW greenfield wind power project in Pakistan, in the Jhimpir wind corridor in the Sindh province (The Project). The Project will be connected to the national grid and will enter into a 25-year Energy Purchase Agreement (EPA) with the Central Power Purchasing Agency Guarantee Limited (CPPA-G).

name.narrative: The Project is located over an area of 462 acres (already acquired via lease) in the Jhimpir Wind Corridor, Thatta district of Sindh province in south-eastern Pakistan, about 100 km east of Karachi
